questions.question_text:
DreamHouse Realty (DR) employees started using company-owned airplanes for work travel after Ursa Major Solar was acquired. DR executives want to automate the submission travel request forms to enforce the internal policy.
How should an app builder automate travel request based on these criteria?

discussion.content: Why is choice B not the correct answer?

Selected Answer: A
I think it is A since it can Submit for Approval automatically if needed. Currently that would be Flow, since they decommission Process Builder.

Selected Answer: C
Workflow is a correct answer, Approval process is not an automation tool at all.
https://www.simplilearn.com/salesforce-automation-tools-article

Selected Answer: B
"automate the submission travel request forms" , auto submitting request to someone to approve.
Ans is B

comments.content: "...submission travel request forms to enforce the internal policy" this seems to me like that needs someone to approve it...

discussion.content: There is no need to have an approval process. There is no manager or request to have someone reviewing and approving it. I believe Workflow rule is right.
Why not A? Paths are needed for the same issue

comments.content: because you would not know which fields to be filled for validation to fire

An app builder needs to create new automation on an object.
What best practice should the app builder follow when building out automation?

choices.C: One record change process per object.

discussion.content: C, one record change process. [ automation tool can be any]
B. One invocable process per object. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.process_considerations_design_bestpractices.htm&type=5

comments.content:
So... the reference you shared says this:

"Have only one record-change process per object.
Each time a record is created or updated, all record-change processes for its object are evaluated. We recommend restricting your org to one record-change process per object."

C seems to be correct.

questions.question_text: What should an app builder do to upgrade an unmanaged package that has been installed into production?

choices.A: Install the new version to a Developer org then deploy to production.
choices.D: Install the new version in a sandbox then deploy to production.
choices.C: Click the update link on the Installed Packages page.
choices.B: Uninstall the current version and install the new version.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It should be B

Selected Answer: B
Should be B. Need to uninstall the current version and then deploy the new version
D seems correct, you need to uninstall unmanaged packages in order to installe new versions again. Fore sure.
